You can get started by opening the navigation menu and exploring the various sections of the app.

One or more restrictions are currently active that impact operations:

%1$s

If these restrictions can be safely ignored, go to "Settings" > "Advanced" to override this behaviour.
- No network connection - the device is not connected to a network
- Restricted or metered network - the device is connected to a network that may incur additional charges for large data transfers
The application is running in debug mode and is connected to a server.
The application is running in mock mode; there is no connection to a server and many features will not work as expected.
In case something is unclear, more information can be found by tapping on this button.

Showing all available backup definitions.

 In order to perform backups, a definition needs to be created first, which is then associated with each backup entry.

 Backup definitions allow for grouping and configuration of backups - how many copies should be kept, for how long and how to version them.

 To show available actions for each definition, long-press an entry.

Showing all available backup entries for the selected definition.

 Each item represents an individual backup that was performed and shows information about when it was done, how much data was stored and what changed since the last backup.

 To show available actions for a backup, long-press an entry.

Showing backup metadata information for the selected entry.

 Each item represents an individual piece of information that was backed up (photo, file, directory, etc) and shows details about what changed since the last backup.

 An item can be expanded to show additional metadata.

Creating or updating a backup definition.

 For each definition,the retention policies for existing and removed file versions can be specified.

 Retention policies:
 - at-most - keep at most N number of versions
 - latest-only - keep only latest version
 - all - keep all versions
Configuring and starting a recovery process.
Searching available metadata for backup information matching the provided query (as a regular expression).\n\n Results can be restricted by searching entries only up to the provided timestamp.

Showing and stopping operations.

 Each item represents an individual operation and shows what its current state is and how many stages or steps have already been performed.

 Operations older than 30 days are automatically removed.

 To show available actions for each operation, long-press an entry.
Showing operation details.\n\n An operation is made up of individual stages and each stage can have one or more steps. Along with this information, any failures or errors will also be shown.
Showing current user and device details, along with the client\'s connection state.

Showing configured backup rules.

 Each rule determines whether matching files and directories are included (✓) or excluded (✗) during backups.

 To show available actions for each rule, long-press an entry.

Showing available files and the rules that affect them.

 Files that are going to be included in the backups are shown in green, those that are explicitly excluded are shown in red and gray is used for files that are not affected by the rules.

 Only explicitly included files will be considered when performing backups!

 To show more details and suggested rules, long-press a file or folder entry.

Showing and managing client scheduling.

 Each item represents a public schedule provided by the server. One or more assignments can be created for each schedule so that the client can execute the specified actions at the appropriate time.

 A schedule can be expanded to show all assignments associated with it.
The requested resource could not be found
Authentication failed; try to log in again…
The application will now guide you through the steps necessary to (re-)initialize this device.
Make sure you are entering the URL of a trusted server and that it is entered exactly as shown by that server.
User name (for connection to the server, when pulling secrets).
This password is required for encrypting the secrets used by this device. Your password is never stored, sent to the server or shared with other services.
Your password is never stored, sent to the server or shared with other services.
If this device has its secret stored on the server, it will be downloaded during bootstrap.
The secret currently stored on the device will be overwritten. Any data encrypted with the current secret may become inaccessible!
Provide a different password for decrypting the downloaded secret.
If the device secret stored on the server was encrypted with a different password, it can be provided here. Otherwise, the current user password will be used for the decryption.
Your password is never stored, sent to the server or shared with other services.
This code is required for securely initializing the device and should be entered exactly as shown by the server.
An invalid bootstrap code was provided.\n\nVerify that the code is entered correctly or obtain a new one.
An unexpected failure was encountered during bootstrap: %1$s
If your password was changed on a different device, this allows decrypting the secret of this device using the old password and re-encrypting it using the new one.
A password needs to be provided
The provided passwords do not match
The provided password is not valid
Allows re-running the bootstrap process for this device.
You can reset your password after logging in or, if that\'s not possible, contact your system administrator.
Start a backup with the default definition
Any information or description that uniquely identifies the backup definition.
Retention policy and duration for existing files.
Retention policy and duration for removed files.
Show details about this backup definition
Start a new backup process using this definition
A new backup operation cannot be started while other operations are running.
Removing backup definition [%1$s] will make all associated backups inaccessible!
Show details about this backup entry
Removing backup entry [%1$s] will make all of its data inaccessible!
Show/hide data saved in previous backups
A new recovery operation cannot be started while other operations are running.

Select a definition from which to recover.

 Data can then be recovered from:
 - latest backup entry - latest backup is used
 - explicitly provided entry - the specified backup is used
 - until a time and date - latest backup before the provided time and date is used

Only files and directories that match the provided query or regular expression will be recovered.

 Examples:
 - /storage/emulated/0/Download/.* - recover all downloads
 - .*.pdf - recover all PDF files
Browse files and add new rules
Removing rule [%1$s] for directory [%2$s] may impact future backup operations. Any data already stored will be unaffected!
Removing all existing rules and resetting them to the device defaults may impact future backup operations. Any data already stored will be unaffected!
Show more information about using the files and rules tree
One or more of the configured rules have inaccessible directories
Include all content in this directory and all subdirectories
Include only content directly in this directory
Exclude this directory and all its content
Include all files with this name (in all directories)
Include all files with this extension (in parent directory)
Include all files with this extension (in all directories)
Exclude all files with this name (in all directories)
Exclude all files with this extension (in parent directory)
Exclude all files with this extension (in all directories)
Removing operation [%1$s] will make all its statistics inaccessible. Any data already stored will be unaffected!
%1$s operation is not associated with a valid schedule
Attempted to execute a schedule with ID [%1$s] but it was not available
The application needs to be restarted for this change to take effect
Include all matching files and folders
Show dates as %1$s and time as %2$s
The client will contact the server every %1$s
The client will query the server for new commands every %1$s
Allows updating the password for the current user
(Advanced) Allows updating the salt value for the current user
Pushes the current device secret to the server
Pulls a device secret from the server, if available
(Advanced) Allows manually exporting the current device secret
(Advanced) Allows manually importing a new secret for this device

This secret is used for encrypting and decrypting data for this device. It should be kept in a secure location and it should not be shared with anyone!

 - If the secret is lost, existing data cannot be decrypted.

 - If the secret is compromised, anyone will be able to decrypt the data coming from this device.

The provided passwords do not match
A salt value needs to be provided
The provided salt values do not match
The provided password is not valid
User salt value update failed with: %1$s
This password is required for encrypting the device secret. Your password is never stored, sent to the server or shared with other services.
Confirming your password ensures that the imported device secret is correctly encrypted.
A password needs to be provided
The provided passwords do not match
The provided password is not valid
The device secret will be pushed to server %1$s.\n\n%2$s
The secret is always encrypted locally before being sent.
This password is required for encrypting the device secret. Your password is never stored, sent to the server or shared with other services.
Confirming your password ensures that the pushed device secret is correctly encrypted.
Password override if the remote secret should have a different password.
A password needs to be provided
The provided passwords do not match
The provided password is not valid
The device secret will be pulled from server %1$s.\n\n%2$s: %3$s
No device secret found on server %1$s.
The secret currently stored on the device will be overwritten. Any data encrypted with the current secret will no longer be accessible!

Failed to retrieve remote device secret status: %1$s
This password is required for decrypting the device secret. Your password is never stored, sent to the server or shared with other services.
Confirming your password ensures that the pushed device secret is correctly encrypted.
Password override if the remote secret has a different password.

No available commands


ID of last processed command was [%1$s]
